Description: The trio-alif (ا - أ - إ): Same shape, different location of alif, absence & different location of hamza (ء), in different position in the word (just prononciation)
The trio baa, taa, thaa (ب - ت – ث): Same shape, different number & location of dots
The trio jiim, haa, khaa (ج - ح – خ): Same shape, different location of a dot
The duo daal and dhaal (د – ذ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo raa and zaay (ر – ز): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo siin and shiin (س – ش): Same shape, absence of three dots
The Saad and Daad (ص – ض): Same shape, absence of a dot
The Taa and DHaa (ط – ظ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo ayn and ghayn (ع – غ): Same shape, absence of a dot
The duo faa and qaaf (ف – ق): Same shape, different number of dots
The duo kaaf and laam (ك – ل): Same shape, absence of hamza (ء)
The duo miim and nuun (م – ن): No specific criterion, just different letters
The trio haa waaw yaa (ه - و - ي): No specific criterion, jusy different letters
The long-vowels “alif” (أ), “waaw” (و), “yaa” (ي)
The two shapes of the letter “alif” (ا ـا)
The four shapes of the letter "baa" (ب   ـب   ـبـ  بـ)

The four shapes of the letter “shiin” (ش ـش ـشـ شـ)
The four shapes of the letter “Saad” (ص ـص ـصـ صـ)
The four shapes of the letter “Daad” (ض ـض ـضـ ضـ)

The four shapes of the letter “haa” (ه  ـه ـهـ هـ)
The two shapes of the letter “waaw” ( ـو  و)
The four shapes of the letter “yaa” (ي ـي ـيـ يـ)
The sound of Fathah (َ) as a short vowel, Fatha on letters, and vocabulary,
The sound of Dammah (ُ) as a short vowel, Dammah on letters, and vocabulary
The sound of Kasrah (ِ) as a short vowel,  Kasrah on letters, and vocabulary
Revision of the 3 previous + The the non sound of the mute Sukun (ْ)
Same than 1 with Fathah tanwin (ً) (double Fathah)
Same than 2 The sound of Dammah tanwin (ٌ) (double Dammah)
Same than 3 The sound of Kasrah tanwin (ٍ) (double Kasrah)

The diphthong “yaa” (ي): different sound than short and long vowel
